page.title: 09CHURCHES IN PENDLESIDE
page.content: There are three churches in the area: St.Mary's (parish)Newchurch;Methodist, Barley; Inghamite Church, Wheatley Lane. St. Mary's dates back to the l6th century and has an "all seeing Eye of God" in the tower, supposedly for protection against witches.The average attendance is 35 with services and a Sunday School held at 9.30am. There is a choir and organist. The graveyard is still used for burials and ashes can be interred or scattered.There has been a Methodist Chapel in Barley since l838.The average congregation is l5 and the minister is on a three months' rota with other chapels in the area. There is no graveyard,but weddings,christen ings and funeral services are still carried out.The Chapel has an organ which was originally in St. Mary's, Newchurch.
